title: Ed Woodward arrives at Carrington following Man Utd draw with Liverpool
text:

Ed Woodward has made a visit to Manchester United's training ground following their draw with Liverpool .

United turned in a much-improved display at Old Trafford and were unfortunate to only come away with a point against the Premier League leaders.

The performance helped relieve some of the pressure on boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, although Woodward has reiterated his support for the Norwegian.

United's executive vice-chairman arrived at the club's Carrington training ground on Monday morning before Solskjaer and his players, at around 8:30am.

(Image: Eamonn and James Clarke)

The United boss was also one of the first in, arriving with his son, as his players undergo a cool-down session following their efforts against Liverpool.

Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial were also among those to arrive with United back in action in the Europa League against Partizan Belgrade on Thursday night.

Woodward, who himself has come under scrutiny for his role in United's transfer dealings, has continued to support boss Solskjaer.

(Image: Eamonn and James Clarke)

(Image: Eamonn and James Clarke)

Speaking ahead of the draw with Liverpool, he said: "We want players to come in who respect their team-mates, the club, the history. They must understand that they are creating a legacy by coming to Manchester United . Nobody is bigger than the club.

'Then, when you go into the dressing room, you put the red shirt on and you feel arrogant, self assured. You want a never-say-die spirit. Ole has brought a lot of the discipline back.

"Whatever manager we have has to buy into that philosophy and Ole is a walking, talking version of that. Let's let this play out with Ole in terms of the culture reboot."

(Image: Eamonn and James Clarke)

Woodward also insisted the Glazers have no plans to sell up, amid more fan protests at Old Trafford.

Sunday Mirror Sport revealed this week that the Saudi Crown Prince is weighing up a third takeover bid for the club.

"Based on what I see, they're in it for the long term," the executive vice-chairman said.

"With regards to offers or asking prices, my understanding is that there have been no discussions for a price for the club or anything like that."
description: Ed Woodward has been supportive of boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, despite United being 13th in the Premier League
